Clip.Title: SKY VIEW
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Soar over Europe and experience the landscape from an eagle's perspective. This remarkable series uses the latest HD and camera mount technology to give the audience a view of Europe and its history that will takes their breath away.

Clip.Title: THE HISTORY OF THE FUTURE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Inquire as to whether the idea of a perfect society is, indeed, possible.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A journey along Nova Scotia's Bay of Fundy coastline is a cultural and geological marvel - from historic Acadian Villages, to world-famous stone formations - rising from the sea.

Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: GREEN PARADISE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Discover destinations around the world, where local economies protect natural resources and wildlife diversity.

Clip.Title: GREEN PARADISE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Discover destinations around the world, where local economies protect natural resources and wildlife diversity.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.Episode: Emotions Revealed, Future History, Amateur Astronomers and 3-D Microscopes
Clip.EpisodeSummary: See how our facial muscles involuntarily reveal emotions like sadness and anger. And, what does our use of bottled water say about us? And, some of the world's most passionate astronomers don't even need to leave their own backyards. And cutting-edge microscopes are helping to create new medical breakthroughs.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.Episode: Chasing Beetles, Finding Darwin and Ladybug Mystery
Clip.EpisodeSummary: When Charles Darwin published "On the Origin of Species," he transformed the biological sciences forever. 150 years later, Darwin's ideas remain as central to scientific exploration as ever. Entomologist David Kavanaugh, who discovered a new species of beetle in 1980, predicted that a second new beetle species would be found in the same area. Find out if his prediction came true.

Clip.Title: SKIN DEEP
Clip.EpisodeSummary: New research reveals the crucial role our skin color plays in our species' survival and reproduction, while dispelling narrow-minded notions that have plagued us throughout history.

Clip.Title: EXTREME CLERGY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Rev Ruth Wright's First United Church welcomes all those who have bottomed out on their luck in Vancouver.

Clip.Title: EXTREME CLERGY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Rabbi Shifren takes inner city LA high school students surfing for the first time to get them out of their 'world is a ghetto mentality.'

Clip.Title: ALL ABOARD
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Trekking accross the barren wastelands of the Australian Outback by rail reveals the desert's unique culture.

Clip.Title: RIVERS OF THE WORLD
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In Venezuela, the Orinoco River was the first to be discovered in the new world and was thought to be the route to El Dorado.

Clip.Title: MYSTICAL JOURNEY: KUMBH MELA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: West meets East when acclaimed actor Dominic West joins his childhood friend on a pilgrimage to Northern India and the biggest religious festival in the world, Kumbh Mela. Here, 100 million Hindus have gathered to wash away their sins in the holy rivers near Allahabad, on the banks of Sangam. It is also where Dominic's friend Sir James Mallinson will be initiated into a senior role called a mahant. Follow these friends on this incredible two-week journey, and submerge yourself in the sacred waters and culture of this triennial celebration.

Clip.Title: ALL ABOARD
